c74object.name: ears.roll.sampling~
c74object.digest: Convert a bach.roll into a montage of audio samples
c74object.description: Bounce a bach.roll object containing soundfile names in a given slot into a buffer

objarg.name: outname
objarg.description: The outname attribute sets a name (or a wrapped list of names) for each of the buffer outles of the objects in ears. These names are only accounted for if the naming mode is 'Static'.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object will open the display window for the output buffer(s). If more than 10 buffers are to be output, only the first 10 are displayed.

method.name: reset
method.description: If the naming attribute is set to 'Dynamic', the reset message will force the dynamic naming to cycle and restart from the first used name. This is especially useful in combination with iterative mechanisms.

method.name: write
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writeaiff
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer (default)), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format

method.name: writemp3
writeraw
method.digest: Save output as raw file with no header
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format

method.name: writewv

attribute.name: audioslot
attribute.digest: Slot Containing File Names Or Buffer Names
attribute.description: Sets the number of the slot containing file names or buffer names.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Slot Containing File Names Or Buffer Names

attribute.name: channelmode
attribute.description:
Sets the channel conversion mode:
0 (Clear) = Delete all samples
1 (Keep) = Only keep existing channels
2 (Pad) = Pad last channel while upmixing
3 (Cycle, default) = Repeat all channels (cycling) while upmixing
4 (Palindrome) = Palindrome cycling of channels while upmixing
5 (Pan) = Pan channels to new configuration

attribute.name: compensate
attribute.digest: Reduce Multichannel Gain To Avoid Clipping
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to automatically reduce the gain of multichannel files by a factor of the number of channels, in order to avoid possible clipping while panning then with low spread values. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Reduce Multichannel Gain To Avoid Clipping

attribute.name: fadein
attribute.description: Sets a global amount of fade in for every sample (in units given by the timeunit attribute).

attribute.name: fadeincurve
attribute.description: Sets the curve parameter for the fade in (for fades of type Curve and S-Curve only). The parameters goes from -1 to 1, 0 being linear (default).

attribute.name: fadeintype
attribute.description: Sets the fade in type: 0 = None, 1 = Linear (default), 2 = Sine, 3 = Curve, 4 = S-Curve;

attribute.name: fadeout
attribute.description: Sets a global amount of fade out for every sample (in units given by the timeunit attribute).

attribute.name: fadeoutcurve
attribute.description: Sets the curve parameter for the fade out (for fades of type Curve and S-Curve only). The parameters goes from -1 to 1, 0 being linear (default).

attribute.name: fadeouttype
attribute.description: Sets the fade in type: 0 = None, 1 = Linear (default), 2 = Sine, 3 = Curve, 4 = S-Curve;

attribute.name: gainslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of the slot containing the gain or gain envelope.

attribute.name: mutesolo
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to account for muting and soloing while bouncing.

attribute.name: naming
attribute.description:
Chooses the output buffer naming policy:
0 (Copy): the buffer name is copied from the input (in-place modification). Notice that some objects do not allow this policy.
1 (Static): a single buffer (and hence buffer name) is created, and always used as output.
2 (Dynamic): a new buffer (and buffer name) is created for each new command. Beware! This may allocate a lot of memory! You can always cycle on a fixed set of names via the reset message.
You can use a shortcut to define the naming policy via a first symbolic argument: use = for copy, - for static and ! for dynamic.

attribute.name: normalize
attribute.description: Sets the normalization mode for the output buffer: 0 = Never, does not normalize; 1 = Always, always normalizes to 1.; 2 (default) = Overload Protection Only, only normalizes to 1. if some samples exceed in modulo 1.

attribute.name: numchannels
attribute.description: Sets the number of output channels.

attribute.name: offsetslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of the slot containing the offset from the beginning of the file.

attribute.name: outname
attribute.description: Sets the name for each one of the buffer outlets. Leave blank to auto-assign unique names.

attribute.name: oversampling
attribute.description: Sets the oversampling factor for subsample processing.

attribute.name: panlaw
attribute.description: Sets the panning law: 0 = nearest neighbor (panned on one loudspeaker at a time); 1 = cosine law (default).

attribute.name: panmode
attribute.description: Sets the panning mode: 0 = linear (default); 1 = circular.

attribute.name: panslot
attribute.description: Sets the number of the slot containing the file names (0 = none).

attribute.name: panvoices
attribute.description: Sets the panning on a voice-by-voice basis (possibly overridden by the panslot). A number for each voice is expected, between 0 (first loudspeaker) and 1 (last loudspeaker). In a standard stereo 0 = left, 1 = right.

attribute.name: resamplingfiltersize
attribute.description: Sets the resampling filter size.

attribute.name: resamplingpolicy
attribute.description: Sets the resampling policy used when buffers have different sample rates: "Don't" (no resampling - beware: temporality is not preserved!), "To lowest" (buffers are to the lowest sample rate), "To highest" (buffers are converted to the highest sample rate), "To most common" (buffers are to the most common sample rate), "To Max Current" (buffers are converted to the current Max sample rate).

attribute.name: spread
attribute.description: Sets the spread of the input channels when panning multichannels buffers. Default is 0 (downmix to mono). A spread of 1 spreads a multichannel signal sent to the central loudspeaker up to the external ones.

attribute.name: sr
attribute.description: Sets the sample rate for the output buffer. If zero (default), the current Max sample rate is used.

attribute.name: timeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for time values: Milliseconds, Samples, Relative (0. to 1. as a percentage of the buffer length). The default is always Milliseconds except for the ears.repeat~, ears.paulstretch~ modules (Relative).

attribute.name: usedurations
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to account for note durations while bouncing.

attribute.name: velmode
attribute.description: Sets the velocity mode: 0 = ignore; 1 = map velocity to amplitude range (default); 2 = map velocity to decibels range. ranges are defined in velrange

attribute.name: velrange
attribute.description: Sets the mapping range for the velocity. This can be either an amplitude range or a decibels range, depending on velmode.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (symbol/list)
entry.description: Output buffer names(s). Name of the bounced buffer
